sentences: Mees ostis ja müüs vana kraami. (The man bought and sold old stuff.)
Ostis turult ka rohelist kraami. (Bought green stuff from the market as well.)
context: Kraam is a versatile Estonian noun that refers to various types of materials, objects, or things. It can mean physical items like furniture, tools, and general goods; foodstuffs and edible items; or more figuratively refer to content or material (like written works). The word appears in many compound forms such as 'mööblikraam' (furniture), 'toidukraam' (foodstuff), and 'vanakraam' (antiques).
